DataElement.preferredName: Vaccine Therapy Sipuleucel-T Complete Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the administration of vaccine therapy comprised of Sipuleucel-T being completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of vaccine therapy comprised of Sipuleucel-T (a cell-based vaccine composed of autologous antigen-presenting peripheral blood mononuclear cells that have been exposed to a recombinant protein consisting of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor) being completed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Active immunization where vaccine is administered for therapeutic or preventive purposes. This can include administration of immunopotentiating agents such as BCG vaccine and Corynebacterium parvum as well as biological response modifiers such as interferons, interleukins, and colony-stimulating factors in order to directly stimulate the immune system.

Concepts.definition: Immunotherapy using a preparation that usually contains a complex mixture of disease-related antigens, immunopotentiating agents, and immunomodulators, which stimulate the immune system to destroy pathogenic microorganisms or tumor cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: A cell-based vaccine composed of autologous antigen-presenting peripheral blood mononuclear cells (enriched for a dendritic cell fraction) that have been exposed to a recombinant protein consisting of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-C:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A cell-based vaccine composed of autologous antigen-presenting peripheral blood mononuclear cells (enriched for a dendritic cell fraction) that have been exposed to a recombinant protein consisting of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) fused to prostatic-acid phosphatase (PAP), a protein expressed by prostate cancer cells.  Upon administration, the vaccine may stimulate an antitumor T-cell response against tumor cells expressing PAP. (NCI05)
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Successfully completed therap
ReferenceDocuments.description: Successfully completed therapy with sipuleucel-T within 3-7 days of planned CYT-107 study drug treatment.
